body.name: Amazon Basics Ultra Thin Pads with Flexi-Wings for Periods, Extra Heavy Overnight Absorbency, Unscented, Size 5, 24 Count, 1 Pack (Previously Solimo)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 11 hrs 56 mins
features: Includes 24 extra-heavy overnight absorbency pads with flexi-wings
Same product, new look—This product is identical in manufacturing and formulation as the Solimo brand
Absorbent core provides up to 8 hours of leakage protection, and Dri-Fit cotton enhanced and breathable outer layers which wick away moisture to help keep your skin dry and comfortable
Flexi-Wings to help pad stay in place, and individually wrapped for discreetness, protection, and convenience
Find your best size with our sizing chart to find coverage that best fits your needs
If you like Always Ultra Thin Pads with Wings, we invite you to try Amazon Basics Ultra Thin Pads with Flexi-Wings
Alexa voice shopping enable to place your next order, just say, “Alexa, add Amazon Basics Ultra Thin Pads to my cart”
body.description: Amazon Basics Ultra Thin Pads with Flexi-Wings, Extra Heavy Overnight Absorbency, Size 5, are designed to provide a new level of skin health and protection through their Dri-Fit technology. The cotton enhanced and breathable outer layers wick away moisture 2x faster to help your skin stay dry and comfortable. The super absorbent core provides up to 10 hours of leakage protection. You can identify your best fit through the sizing chart to help prevent leaks and get the ultimate coverage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Cost-Effective Solution: My Take on Amazon Basics Maxi Pads
reviews.reviewText: As a husband and father frequently tasked with purchasing pads for my wife and daughter, I've navigated the vast sea of menstrual care products, often veering towards cost-effective solutions over big-name brands.My logic was simple: why pay more for a product when its alternatives seem to offer the same basic functionality? This perspective, admittedly from a man's viewpoint, recently led me to test the waters with Amazon Basics Maxi Pads. Here's my honest assessment of their performance compared to more renowned brands.Quality and Effectiveness: Contrary to my initial skepticism, Amazon Basics Maxi Pads have demonstrated remarkable effectiveness. The concern with absorption and leakage is paramount when it comes to menstrual products—a reality I've become increasingly aware of through the experiences shared by my wife and daughter. To my relief, Amazon Basics has not only met but exceeded expectations in this regard, standing toe-to-toe with the big names in terms of reliability and comfort.Cost vs. Performance: The decision to try Amazon Basics was primarily driven by the potential cost savings. However, I was pleasantly surprised to find that the lower price point did not equate to a compromise in quality. The pads provide the necessary protection and assurance, making them a viable option for those looking to manage menstrual care expenses without sacrificing performance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My new to go pad
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely locks in my period so I have yet to have a leakage, I have had seriously heavy periods but this pad is certainly amazing, I don’t know why their is adhesion complaints to this pad but for me it definitely sticks on. But my only downfall for this is it sticks too well it ripped a few because the glue was really strong. But I rather it be too strong then too weak. So I like it

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Work just as about as well as name brand
reviews.reviewText: I converted to Amazon brand during the pandemic when I no longer wanted to enter a store for every thing that I needed. I find these to be comparable enough to Always brand as far as comfort and absorbancy are concerned. The only difference I really notice is that they don't stick quite as well to my underwear. But that is something I can work with. They are comfortable and they do their job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cheap and functional.
reviews.reviewText: These Amazon pads are really cheap and despite that they work great. I'm not sure if they pump a bunch of chemicals into these pads like I've read online but they work for their intended purpose. I just get rashes while wearing any pads and unfortunately these aren't an exemption. A lot come in a pack too so they last you a while.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I have been buying brand name liners for a while and decided to try these. They seem to do the same as others. I will buy again.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars The length is great.
reviews.reviewText: I ordered these because I wanted an extra long pad. I trust the name Always and this is a generic brand like Always. It's a thin pad. The one thing I am very disappointed about is that it isn't very absorbent. I was expecting this to be extra absorbent. It's not extra. It still leaks when there's any high level of fluid. It drips when I use it more than a normal amount. I would buy this again if I had better results.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Decent Generic Brand
reviews.reviewText: I subscribed to receiving a pack of these each month. The price is excellent. They are good quality, pretty absorbent, and stay securely in place, thanks to the wings. I don’t see much of a difference between these and the store brands that I’ve tried, other than the lower price. That’s the best part.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I think these pads are great. They are affordable. I like them very thin and they are. But I see that they are the same as the Walmart name brand. Of course I had no idea these Amazon pads were identical as the Walmart. Next time I'll check on Walmart and compare the price. Since they are the same product. I won't recommend these if you are a heavy bleeder.
